Description of incident: Unauthorized individuals used IDs and passwords of legitimate  customers to obtain consumers' Social Security numbers, driver's license  numbers, and names and addresses.           Most of the breaches were at the company's subsidiary  Seisint Inc., based in Florida. UPDATE (4/12/05) An internal investigation at LexisNexis has uncovered evidence that an additional 280,000 records may have been involved in this breach, increasing the total from 30,000 to 310,000.UPDATE             (06/30/06): Five men were arrested in connection with this              breach.
